related_questions.question: How to cite a PowerPoint presentation in MLA?
related_questions.snippet: Instructor's Presentation Slides (e.g., PowerPoint) Instructor's Last Name, First Name. "Title of PowerPoint Presentation." Title of Course, Date of PowerPoint presentation, University Name. Microsoft PowerPoint presentation.
related_questions.title: MLA Citation Guide (8th Edition): Class Notes & Presentations

related_questions.question: How do you cite Microsoft PowerPoint?
related_questions.snippet: When citing Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Excel in your paper, you can mention the specific version number (e.g., Microsoft PowerPoint 2021, Microsoft Excel 2021) and the release year (2021). Additionally, you can include the publisher (Microsoft Corporation) in the citation to provide more detailed information.
related_questions.title: Cite powerpoint - Microsoft Community

related_questions.question: How to cite a PowerPoint with no Author in MLA?
related_questions.snippet: If a source has no author, start the MLA Works Cited entry with the source title. Use a shortened version of the title in your MLA in-text citation.
related_questions.title: How to Cite a PowerPoint in MLA | Format & Examples - Scribbr

related_questions.question: How do you cite someone's PowerPoint presentation?
related_questions.snippet: If you want to cite a PowerPoint in MLA or APA style, you need to have basic information including the name of the author(s), title of the presentation, date and place of publication, and URL. For in-text citations, you need to include only the author name(s) in MLA style and author name(s) and year in APA style.
related_questions.title: How to Cite a PowerPoint Presentation in APA, MLA or Chicago

text_blocks.snippet: To cite a PowerPoint presentation in MLA style, you should include the presenter's name, the presentation title (in quotation marks), the course name and number (if applicable), the date, and the type of presentation ("Microsoft PowerPoint presentation"). If the presentation is available online, also include the website name and URL.
snippet_highlighted_words: include the presenter's name, the presentation title (in quotation marks), the course name and number (if applicable), the date, and the type of presentation ("Microsoft PowerPoint presentation")

text_blocks.snippet: Author's Last Name, First Name. "Title of PowerPoint Presentation." Title of Course, Date of Presentation, University Name. Microsoft PowerPoint presentation.
Smith, John. "The History of the Internet." Computer Science 101, 15 May 2024, Example University. Microsoft PowerPoint presentation.
Author's Last Name, First Name. "Title of PowerPoint Presentation." Website Name, Date of Publication, URL.
Doe, Jane. "Effective Time Management." Skills for Success, 20 June 2024, www.example.com/timemanagement.

list.snippet: Include the author's last name and the relevant slide number in your in-text citation, according to Scribbr.
If the presentation is from a specific class, include the course name and number.
If the presentation is from a conference, include the conference name and location.
If there are multiple authors, list them all, or use "et al." after the first author's name.
Include a "Works Cited" page at the end of your paper or presentation, listing all cited sources.
If you're citing a lecture or speech, follow a similar format, but replace "Microsoft PowerPoint presentation" with "Lecture" or "Speech".
